snippet: White House officials unveiled a new website that does not attempt to rate schools, but provides information about annual costs, graduation rates and salaries after graduation.
abstract: College Scorecard, new government website with key information on 7,000 American colleges, launches without rating system originally promised by Pres Obama; plan to hold low-performing schools accountable to students and taxpayers who fund federal grants is ridiculed by many education leaders; site's inventory of unique data is praised, despite lack of rankings.
lead_paragraph: White House officials unveiled a new website that does not attempt to rate schools, but provides information about annual costs, graduation rates and salaries after graduation.

headline.main: With Website to Research Colleges, Obama Abandons Ranking System
headline.print_headline: With New Website to Research Colleges, Obama Abandons Plan to Rank Schools on Quality
